text:
Can we disable Cookie banner only for one page ??
e.g. we need cookie banner in all page for <http://www.mywebsite.com|www.mywebsite.com> but need to disable it for <http://www.mywebsite.com/test|www.mywebsite.com/test>
If not, please upvote :)
Let me know your thoughts on this <https://twitter.com/SuvagiyaJd/status/1234764937240752128>

Anybody come across a decent way to add a better date picker to native HubSpot forms? I know I could use my own date picker script on a custom form but this one is buried deep into a big embedded form
Hey all, has anyone successfully done a LinkedIn "Share this article" link with a custom message included?

We were able to do this for Facebook and Twitter using methods similar to: <https://css-tricks.com/simple-social-sharing-links/> or using their JS SDK's. For LinkedIn, however, they seem to have deprecated the functionality I've previously used. The link still works, but now only accepts the url, and stripping any other parameters. The only other option is their API which requires multi-step authentication which I think would mean building out a web service, and not the best user experience IMO. This seems like something that should be simple, so wondering if I'm missing something.
Hey all, do you know an add-on that allows me to upload confidential content on my private AWS S3 bucket and show the files as attachemnts inside HubSpot contact page?

Hi. I'm wanting to develop a HubSpot CMS website in one account and then be able to transfer templates and modules from that account to another. I can see exporting and importing templates seems straightforward. what about modules?
no not yet. how does that work?
This is officially out of beta now: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development>
If you use local development can you deploy templates and modules to different HubSpot accounts?

There’s a couple of ways to move modules in between portals.  The first is what Umakant is mentioning above.  In the design manager, you can right click on an individual module and move it to another portal that way.
Or, if you would like to do it in bulk, you can use the local development tools
yup, you can fetch from one portal and then upload to another
great thanks

****This only works with templates, modules, themes*****

You can’t move page content with this tool
No problem!
when I right click I see copy to portal, do I just need portal name?
as long as it's possible I guess I can work out details when that's ready, if that's easy
You’ll need to be a user in both portals and then it should show up
excellent
we used this method in our free marketplace module <https://marketplace.HubSpot.com/products/kelp-agency/simple-social-sharing>
can't say that i've tested the linkedin message any time soon but i'll have to go check that now

Hi everyone! I am trying to change the dnd template to CSS Grid. It works but only for the  everything outside of the dnd-area.  Is it not possible to have the dnd_sections, dnd_columns and dnd_rows to arrange as a CSS Grid?
you would need to provide your own version of <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/css/layout.css> implemented with css grid
i have tried this
one thing that i think would be hard to handle is the nesting
we would eventually like to explore alternative HTML structures for drag-and-drop areas, but i don’t know when that might happen
yes that is not working, i can have the dnd_section 2/3 for example but i can´t have another dnd_section besides it (remaining 1/3)
thanks for the infos <@U22VBL87M>!

if you have some sort of proof-of-concept that you can share, i’d be curious to see it and play around with it. part of the idea behind open sourcing the boilerplate was to support more community exploration.
